bill_title: limit the deployment of the National Guard for federal service.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to limit the deployment of the National Guard for federal service. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 33-3 be amended with a NEW SECTION: The South Dakota National Guard and any member thereof may not be called into active-duty combat unless the United States Congress has made an official declaration of war or has taken an official action pursuant to Article I, § 8, Clause 15 of the United States Constitution, to explicitly call forth the South Dakota National Guard and any member thereof for the enumerated purposes to execute the laws of the Union, repel an invasion, or suppress an insurrection. The Governor shall take all actions necessary to comply with the requirements of this section. The term, active-duty combat, as used in this section, means: (1) Participation in an armed conflict; (2) Performance of a hazardous service related to an armed conflict in a foreign nation; or (3) Performance of a duty through an instrumentality of war.
